text: Answer: (b) and (d) Solution: In 8 - bit we can store any value between â€”(251) to (281 - 1) = -128 to +127. If we store value greater than [F127 and store value less than -128, will give you overflow. So (a) OXFFFF = (1111 1111 1111 1111)2, = (0000 0000 0000 0001); = (-1)10 (b) OXFF7F = (1111 1111 0111 1111), = (0000 0000 1000 0001) = (-129)10 (c) 0x007D = (0000 0000 0111 1101)-,= (0000 0000 0111 1101), = (125)10 (d) 0x0080 = (0000 0000 1000 1000)> = (0000 0000 1000 0000), = (128)10 So, value OXFF7F and 0x0080 will overflow in 8 bit two's complement number.
